intro: Potentilla buchtarmensis, commonly known as the Bukhtarmen cinquefoil, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with dark green, serrated leaves and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
